Gradient Descent With Momentum¶

class optimizers.GradientDescentWithMomentum.GradientDescentWithMomentum(momentum=0.9, learning_rate=0.001)[source]¶

Implements the Gradient Descent with Momentum optimizer.

This optimizer accelerates convergence by adding ‘inertia’ (velocity) to the parameter updates. It ‘remembers’ the direction of the last step, which helps navigate ravines in the loss landscape and avoid shallow local minima.

The update formulas are: 1. v_t = momentum * v_{t-1} - learning_rate * g_t 2. θ_t = θ_{t-1} + v_t

lr¶

The learning rate (ε).

Type:

float

momentum¶

The momentum factor (α) that controls inertia.

Type:

float

velocity¶

The ‘memory’ that stores the velocity for each parameter.

Type:

list

step(params, grads)[source]¶

Performs a single optimization step for all parameters.

Parameters:

  • params (list) – A list of lists containing the model’s parameters. Expected structure: [[weights1, biases1], [weights2, biases2], …]

  • grads (list) – A list of lists containing the gradients for each parameter, with the same structure as params.
